contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|mad}} '''Mad''' or '''MAD''' may refer to: * Infection with [[rabies]], from the Latin term for madness * [[Moroccan dirham]], the ISO 4217 code for the currency of Morocco * The state of having [[anger]] * The state of [[insanity]] * A variant of the Hindi-Urdu word for alcohol, [[madhu]], pronounced with a soft "d" and cognate with the word mead == Title == * A variant of the Serer word for king, ''Maad'' such as [[Maad a Sinig]] and [[Maad Saloum]] (king of Sine and Saloum respectively) == Businesses and companies == * [[MAD Studio]], an architectural firm == Media and entertainment == ===Literature and publications=== * [[Mad (magazine)|''Mad'' (magazine)]], an American humor magazine === Television and video === * [[Mad (TV series)|''Mad'' (TV series)]], a television series on Cartoon Network based on the magazine * [[MAD TV (Greece)]], a Greek music channel * [[MADtv]], an American sketch comedy television series === Music === * [[Mad (band)]], a rock band from Buenos Aires, Argentina * [[Mad (song)|"Mad" (song)]], a 2008 song by Ne-Yo * "Mad", a song by Magnetic Man from the album ''[[Magnetic Man (album)|Magnetic Man]]'' == Places == * [[Mad (village)]], a village in the Dunajská Streda District of Slovakia * [[Mad River (disambiguation)]], various rivers * [[Madrid Barajas Airport]]'s IATA airport code == Acronym == * [[Magnetic anomaly detector]], a scientific instrument and anti-submarine warfare detection device * M.A.D., a fictional evil organization led by Dr. Claw from the cartoon series ''[[Inspector Gadget]]'' * [[Make A Difference]], an Indian NGO * [[Mandibular advancement device]], an appliance worn in the mouth to treat obstructive sleep apnea or snoring * [[Maritime anomaly detection]], an area of scientific study within [[Global Maritime Situational Awareness]] aimed at avoiding maritime collisions * [[Market Abuse Directive]], [[European company law]] on insider dealing and market manipulation * [[Mastertronic's Added Dimension]] (or "Mastertronic Added Dimension"), a sub-label owned by defunct UK software publisher Mastertronic * [[Mean absolute difference]], a measure of statistical dispersion * [[Median absolute deviation]], a statistical measure of variability, more resistant to outliers than other measures * [[Meg and Dia]], American indie rock band * [[Methodical Accelerator Design]], a [[CERN]] scripting language for particle accelerator design and analysis of optics and beam dynamics. * [[MAD (programming language)]], for Michigan Algorithm Decoder, a computer programming language * MIFARE Application Directory, a data structure on [[MIFARE]] contactless chips * [[Militärischer Abschirmdienst]], the Military Counterintelligence division of the German Army * Minimum absolute deviation, also known as [[Least absolute deviations]] * [[Mothers against decapentaplegic]], a protein of the SMAD family * [[MPEG Audio Decoder]], an audio decompression software * [[Multi-conjugate Adaptive optics Demonstrator]], astronomical method of using multiple guide stars and deformable mirrors to sense and correct for the distortions produced by turbulence in Earth's atmosphere * [[Multi-wavelength anomalous dispersion]], a technique used in X-ray crystallography * [[Museum of Arts & Design]], located in New York City * [[Mutual assured destruction]], a doctrine of military strategy ==See also== * [[List of people known as the Mad]] {{disambig}}
